column4: hi, my graphical interface doesnt work properly anymore, ie. I can't use nvidia anymore. When I do I get the xorg message that EDID of CRT-0 can't be found or something like that. What do I do?
it means that udev is asking the monitor what it can do, and its not talking back
ok, how do I fix that?
if you run: sudo nvidia-xconfig ,the system will make an xorg.conf file with some ok settings for refresh rates which will tell the system what's what instead of the system working it out for itself
you can then reboot and it should be ok
I tried that it didn't do anything useful (ie. it didnt work at all)
does your xorg.conf file now have text in it?
of course
at the moment I use "nv" instead of "nvidia"
lucid doesn't ship one so no, not ofcourse
you need to put stuff in the screen and monitor sections to define refresh rates as your monitor is not talking back to the system
if there is no xorg.conf how does the graphical interface know which driver to use?
but I dont know those settings
hunt online for sample files, you will find sections or code you can use in your file, you will need: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf ,to get write access
but how do I know which settings to put there? if I just copy a file from the internet it will most probably not be a good setting
it should be possible to autodetect such settings
it is but you monitor doesn't do it
hmm or how do I get the EDID to work? I mean something is obviously wrong since the new release of ubuntu (it worked perfectly before without entering anything)
new monitor, or connect it to the white connector instead of vga
then rerun: sudo nvidia-xconfig ,to get a virgin file
how do you mean 'connect'? If you ping it makes a connection..
